    • Method Detail

      • tryJoinLines

        public int tryJoinLines(Document document,
                        PsiFile file,
                        int start,
                        int end)
        Description copied from interface: JoinLinesHandlerDelegate
        Tries to join lines at the specified position of the specified file. Method is called on a document where part of whitespace between lines is already stripped, and it has a chance to smooth out the join point.
        Specified by:
        tryJoinLines in interface JoinLinesHandlerDelegate
        Parameters:
        document - where the lines are
        file - where the lines are
        start - offset where the whitespace between lines starts
        end - offset where the whitespace between lines ends
        Returns:
        the position to place the caret after the operation, or JoinLinesHandlerDelegate.CANNOT_JOIN if this handler was not able to perform the operation.

      • getInitializerExpression

        public static PsiExpression getInitializerExpression(PsiLocalVariable var,
                                                     PsiAssignmentExpression assignment)
        Returns an updated initializer after joining with given assignment
        Parameters:
        var - variable which initializer should be updated
        assignment - assignment to merge into the initializer
        Returns:
        updated initializer or null if operation cannot be performed (e.g. code is incomplete)

      • getInitializerExpression

        public static PsiExpression getInitializerExpression(PsiExpression initializer,

      • joinDeclarationAndAssignment

        public static PsiLocalVariable joinDeclarationAndAssignment(PsiLocalVariable variable,
                                                            PsiAssignmentExpression assignment)
        Join declaration and assignment
        Parameters:
        variable - variable
        assignment - assignment (assuming its parent is expression statement)
        Returns:
        new variable
